headline: Christopher Grady Joins Northrop Grumman Board of Directors
summary: FALLS CHURCH, Va., Feb. 13, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Northrop Grumman (NYSE: NOC) announced it has elected Admiral Christopher Grady, former vice chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, to its board of directors. “With his storied military service and leadership, Admiral Grady will provide valuable insights to our board and management team, as our company continues to focus on delivering differentiating technology to the United States and its allies, at speed and scale,” said Kathy Warden, chair,

headline: Exxon, Walmart and 9 Other Stocks That Are Soaring Because Cash Is King Again
summary: With Wall Street worried artificial intelligence is coming for white-collar jobs, hard-hat and other “real economy” stocks are suddenly fashionable again.  It has been a difficult few weeks for stocks that look vulnerable to AI disruption, with selloffs rocking everything from software to financials to media.  “The relative winner is asset-heavy cash returners,” wrote 22V Research President Dennis DeBusschere in a note Friday, highlighting strong performance of materials, energy, real estate investment trusts, and staples—all sectors that have outperformed the  , which is essentially flat in 2026.

headline: General Dynamics Paid Investors $1.50: Here’s What the Dividend Reveals
summary: General Dynamics paid its quarterly dividend of $1.50 per share on February 6, 2026, marking the latest installment in a 27-year consecutive payment streak that has rewarded shareholders through multiple defense cycles. The aerospace and defense contractor now yields 1.67% at current prices, with an annualized payout of $6.00 per share based on the current ... headline: Northrop Grumman Record Backlog Puts Dividend And Growth Plans In Focus
summary: Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) reported a new company record for order backlog, highlighting strong demand for its aerospace and defense offerings. The company also announced a newly declared dividend, drawing attention to its current approach to capital allocation and shareholder returns. These developments are prompting fresh interest in how Northrop Grumman may balance investment in growth with returning cash to investors. Northrop Grumman sits at the center of key defense and aerospace...

headline: Dividend Hike Amid Softer 2026 Outlook Could Be A Game Changer For Northrop Grumman (NOC)
summary: In early February 2026, Northrop Grumman’s board declared a quarterly dividend of US$2.31 per share, payable on March 11, 2026, to shareholders of record as of February 23, 2026. This announcement followed quarterly results where the company beat earnings expectations but issued softer sales and earnings guidance for 2026 despite a record US$95.70 billion backlog. Next, we’ll examine how Northrop’s earnings beat but softer 2026 guidance may affect its investment narrative and perceived...
